pr_title: Don't throw an error if container is stopped

timeline.bodyText: Most changes are from removing lambdas, the real change is removing the exception and just making it a noop.
timeline.author: stuartwdouglas

replies.bodyText: Sounds good for shutdown, but what if this happens in other scenarios? Shouldn't we at least log something?
replies.author: manovotn

replies.bodyText: I don't think it matters, if the container is gone there is no request context anymore.
replies.author: stuartwdouglas

replies.bodyText: Actually. never mind. Checking on history, this check was added specifically because of shutdown scenario.
replies.author: manovotn

timeline.message:
Don't throw an error if container is stopped

This can happen on shutdown, and can prevent
rective messaging shutting down correctly,
causing tests to fail.
